status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Digest 10 μg of genomic DNA overnight with desired restriction enzymes for each Southern blot probe. (10 μg per 1 well on gel)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Digest 10 μg of genomic DNA overnight with desired restriction enzymes for each Southern blot probe. (10 μg per 1 well on gel)

components.data: After digest add 6x loading dye, incubate 3-5 min at 55-65°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After digest add 6x loading dye, incubate 3-5 min at 55-65°C

components.data: Run 0.75 % agarose gel (70 V without EtHBr), approximately 3-3.5 hours while bromophenol reach the end of the gel
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Run 0.75 % agarose gel (70 V without EtHBr), approximately 3-3.5 hours while bromophenol reach the end of the gel

components.data: Stain the gel later because EtHBr influences DNA migration, 15-20min. (~0.5l + 20ul-30ul EtBr, the solution should slightly change the colour). If the gel is big put it on the plastic bag or food film – it will be easier to take it out without damage
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stain the gel later because EtHBr influences DNA migration, 15-20min. (~0.5l + 20ul-30ul EtBr, the solution should slightly change the colour). If the gel is big put it on the plastic bag or food film – it will be easier to take it out without damage

components.data: Document gel with fluorescent marker. Place ruler alongside the gel in order to estimate distance of DNA band migration directly from photo.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Document gel with fluorescent marker. Place ruler alongside the gel in order to estimate distance of DNA band migration directly from photo.

components.data: Cut part with the gel pockets and unused areas of the gel, trim 1 angle
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut part with the gel pockets and unused areas of the gel, trim 1 angle

components.data:
Presoak gel in 0.125 M HCl (not too old) for max ~10 min at RT (depurination for more efficient transfer)

// pH ~ 1; Bromphenol has to turn yellow-grey; Orange G stays the same
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Presoak gel in 0.125 M HCl (not too old) for max ~10 min at RT (depurination for more efficient transfer)

// pH ~ 1; Bromphenol has to turn yellow-grey; Orange G stays the same

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse 3 times in dH2O, ~5 min, change dH2O 3 times
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse 3 times in dH2O, ~5 min, change dH2O 3 times

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data:
Denature for 30 min at RT

// pH ~ 14; Orange G turns red-brown; gel shrinks
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Denature for 30 min at RT

// pH ~ 14; Orange G turns red-brown; gel shrinks

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse 3 times in dH2O, ~5 min, change dH2O 3 times
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse 3 times in dH2O, ~5 min, change dH2O 3 times

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data:
Neutralize for 30 min at RT, 

// pH ~ 7-8, Orange G turns yellow again
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Neutralize for 30 min at RT, 

// pH ~ 7-8, Orange G turns yellow again

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data: Rinse 3 times in dH2O, ~5 min, change dH2O 3 times
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse 3 times in dH2O, ~5 min, change dH2O 3 times

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data: Keep gel in 20x SSC
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep gel in 20x SSC

components.data: Transfer
components.name: Section

components.data: Cut Zeta-Probe blotting membrane of exactly the same size as the gel. Trim 1 angle of the membrane as in the gel  and mark 3 parts of the membrane with 2 small cuts, put membrane in dH2O // one side at a time and transfer wet membrane into 20x SSC for at least 5 min
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut Zeta-Probe blotting membrane of exactly the same size as the gel. Trim 1 angle of the membrane as in the gel  and mark 3 parts of the membrane with 2 small cuts, put membrane in dH2O // one side at a time and transfer wet membrane into 20x SSC for at least 5 min

components.data: repare Whatman filter paper: 1filter paper should be +2 cm for each size to douse it into the 20xSSC buffer; 2 1filter paper should have the same size as glass. Pre-wet Whatman filter paper in 20x SSC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: repare Whatman filter paper: 1filter paper should be +2 cm for each size to douse it into the 20xSSC buffer; 2 1filter paper should have the same size as glass. Pre-wet Whatman filter paper in 20x SSC.

components.data: Invert the gel, DNA part should be close to the membrane
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Invert the gel, DNA part should be close to the membrane

components.data: Blotting
components.name: Section

components.data: Make sure there is no bubbles between the membrane and the gel
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make sure there is no bubbles between the membrane and the gel

components.data: Cover the first layer filter paper with food film to isolate it from napkins. Make sure there is no short-cut between the filter paper and the
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the first layer filter paper with food film to isolate it from napkins. Make sure there is no short-cut between the filter paper and the

components.data: Cross-link DNA using Auto crosslink option // membrane with DNA should face upward
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cross-link DNA using Auto crosslink option // membrane with DNA should face upward

components.data:
Radioactive decay calculator (Phosphorus32-alpha)

1) Add the following components into 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube:

DNA template

100 ng

Decanucleotide in 5X Reaction Buffer 

10 μl

 

Water, nuclease-free

 X μl (depends on V of[α- 32 P]-dATP) 

Vortex the tube and spin down in a microcentrifuge for 3-5 s. Incubate the tube in a boiling water bath for 5-10 min and cool on ice. Spin down briefly.

2) Add the following components to the same tube:

Mix A

3 μl

[α-32 P]-dATP (minimum 16.5 μCi  per reaction)

X μl

Klenow fragment, Exo – (5 u) 

1 μl

Total V of reaction should be 50 μl. Vortex the tube and spin down briefly. Incubate for 5 min at 37°C.

3) Add 4 μl of dNTP Mix and incubate for 5 min at 37°C.

4)  Purify probe using the Illustra G-50 column
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Radioactive decay calculator (Phosphorus32-alpha)

1) Add the following components into 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube:

DNA template

100 ng

Decanucleotide in 5X Reaction Buffer 

10 μl

 

Water, nuclease-free

 X μl (depends on V of[α- 32 P]-dATP) 

Vortex the tube and spin down in a microcentrifuge for 3-5 s. Incubate the tube in a boiling water bath for 5-10 min and cool on ice. Spin down briefly.

2) Add the following components to the same tube:

Mix A

3 μl

[α-32 P]-dATP (minimum 16.5 μCi  per reaction)

X μl

Klenow fragment, Exo – (5 u) 

1 μl

Total V of reaction should be 50 μl. Vortex the tube and spin down briefly. Incubate for 5 min at 37°C.

3) Add 4 μl of dNTP Mix and incubate for 5 min at 37°C.

4)  Purify probe using the Illustra G-50 column

components.data: Radioactive DNA Labeling (Thermo Scientific DecaLabel DNA Labeling Kit, #K0622)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Radioactive DNA Labeling (Thermo Scientific DecaLabel DNA Labeling Kit, #K0622)

components.data: Probe purification (Illustra G-50 columns, GE Healthcare, #28-9034-08)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Probe purification (Illustra G-50 columns, GE Healthcare, #28-9034-08)

components.data:
1) Preheat Ultrahyb at 60°C and keep it until prehyb step.

2) Put blotted Zeta-Probe membrane inside a 50 ml falcon tube DNA side facing inwards.

2) Pipet 6-10 ml of hybridization solution inside the falcon tube:

0.5 M Na2HPO4, pH 7.2

7% (w/v) SDS

Put 50 ml falcon tube to big glass hybridization tube.

3) Incubate in hybridization oven at 60°C for 1 hour.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1) Preheat Ultrahyb at 60°C and keep it until prehyb step.

2) Put blotted Zeta-Probe membrane inside a 50 ml falcon tube DNA side facing inwards.

2) Pipet 6-10 ml of hybridization solution inside the falcon tube:

0.5 M Na2HPO4, pH 7.2

7% (w/v) SDS

Put 50 ml falcon tube to big glass hybridization tube.

3) Incubate in hybridization oven at 60°C for 1 hour.

components.data: Prehybridization (from Zeta-Probe membrane protocol)
components.name: Section

components.data:
1) Add the denatured probe. Hybridize overnight (~16 hours) at 60°C with agitation.

2) Carefully pour the hybridization solution with labeled probe to 15 ml falcon tube. It can be reused during 1 week. Keep it at -20°C in the radioactive material container.

Note: At no stage, before washing should the membranes be permitted to dry
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1) Add the denatured probe. Hybridize overnight (~16 hours) at 60°C with agitation.

2) Carefully pour the hybridization solution with labeled probe to 15 ml falcon tube. It can be reused during 1 week. Keep it at -20°C in the radioactive material container.

Note: At no stage, before washing should the membranes be permitted to dry

components.data: Hybridization (from Zeta-Probe membrane protocol)
components.name: Section

components.data:
1) Wash the membrane at 60°C: rinse 1 time (in 5 ml) and wash 2 times (in 10 ml) for 10 min each, in the following:

1x SSC

0.1% (w/v) SDS

The first wash should be conducted at room temperature; the second and third washes should be conducted in the hybridization oven.

2) Wash the membrane at 60°C, 2 times for 30 min each, in the following:

0.1x SSC

0.1% (w/v) SDS

These washes should be conducted in the hybridization oven.

3)  After washing, the blotted membranes are ready for autoradiography. Put moist membrane on filter paper wetted in MQ and put them in a sealable plastic bag.

4) Keep the screen under the light for 20-30 min.

Start exposure in Fuji Imaging phosphor screen (Art. No. 28956475, BAS-MS 2025, 20x25 cm).

Scan phosphor screen in 4 hours in P-imager (Amersham, GE Healthcare, Typhoon 9400),.
components.name: Description

These washes should be conducted in the hybridization oven.

3)  After washing, the blotted membranes are ready for autoradiography. Put moist membrane on filter paper wetted in MQ and put them in a sealable plastic bag.

4) Keep the screen under the light for 20-30 min.
